shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” (fols. 1va-108vb) I-1) ʾƎsäggǝd lä-mäläkotǝkä “I worship Thy Godhead…” (fols. 1va-2vb) I-2) Introduction (fols. 3ra-8rb) - On John the Evangelist as the author of the book; on the creation and the fall of the angels (fols. 3ra-5rb) - Story of the family of Adam (fols. 5rb-8rb) I-3) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”: 42 miracles (fols. 8rb-108vb)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: Zä-Wäldä Maryam and his wife Bǝṣǝʿt Maryam are mentioned in supplication formulas. Zä-Wäldä Maryam is mentioned as the commissioner and donor in Additio 1.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. was resewn. The spine cover is missing.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather (spine cover is missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, criss-cross, cross-hatching, corni-form, small x).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: I(2/fols. 1r-2v) – II(10/fol. 3r-12v) – III(10; s.l.: 5, stub after 6; 6, stub after 5/fols. 13r-22v) – IV(10/fols. 23r-32v) – V(10/fols. 33r-42v) – VI(10/fols. 43r-52v) – VII(10/fols. 53r-62v) – VIII(10/fols. 63r-72v) – IX(10/fols. 73r-82v) – X(10/fols. 83r-92v) – XI(10; s.l.: 5, stub after 6; 6, stub after 5/fols. 93r-102v) – XII(6/fols. 103r-108v) – B(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 1; 2, stub before 2/fols. 109r-110v).

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling (occasionally below the ruling, e.g., 46r, 49r, 52r, 55r). The bottom line is written above the ruling (the bottom line is very oft left without writing: e.g., fols. 3r-12v, 15rv, 25r-27r, 33r-40ra, 65r-68v, 70r-81r, 90r-102r; occasionally the last two lines are left without writing: e.g., fols. 45rv, 50rv, 61rv).

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand:
The handwriting changes from careful and neat at the very beginning (quire I) to mediocre (quires II-XII). It appears irregular throughout the Ms. due to variations in ruling (space between the lines differs: e.g., fol. 43r; slant writing lines: e.g., fols. 16rv, 17rv, 19rv, 36rv); broad, irregularly spaced and shaped letters (e.g., fols. 26ra, 34vab, 49vb); form of 'six' ፮, looking like "compressed" number 'seven'.
The handwriting is similar to that of the scribe Zä-Wäldä Maryam (see e.g., QSM-001 [1745], QSM-007 [1745], MR-008 [1770-1775], UM-042 [1760-1800].

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; incipit of Text I-1; incipit of Text I-2 and of its sections (fols. 5rb, 7rb); incipit of Text I-3, of its sections and of some subsections (e.g., 4th miracle: fol. 14ra; 32th miracle: fols. 55va, 58ra, 59vb, 61vb, 62vb, 63va, 66va, 67va, 69rb, 71rb, 73ra; 35th miracle: fols. 80ra, 81ra; 36th miracle: fols. 84va, 86vb; 38th miracle: 92vb, 95ra; 42th miracle: 105vb, 107ra); numbers of miracles; words ʾǝsäggǝd "I worship", mǝʿǝraf "chapter" and its abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: እሰ፡ for እሰግድ፡ (fols. 1v-2v) ለዓ፡ ዓ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ (e.g., fol. 77vb) ለዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 27ra) ለ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 32va, 39rb, 52va) ለ፡ ዓ፡ ለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 37vb) ለዓ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 31ra) ለዓለመ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 53va) ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 30va)

additional.det: The note is written in the main hand, rhymed. Zä-Wäldä Maryam is mentioned as the commissioner and donor.

extras.extra: - In some sections of a few miracles the word mǝʿǝraf "chapter" has been erased and replaced with a supplication note for the donor Zä-Wäldä Maryam written in fine small script: fols. 55va, 58ra, 59vb, 61vb, 62vb, 63va, 66va, 67va, 69rb, 81ra, 84va, 86vb, 92vb, 95ra, 105vb, 107ra. - Erased note: fol. 107va (several lines). - Crude, recent ownership note written in pen: fol. 108v. - Minor notes: fols. 8r and 26r (crossed out), 93v. - Drawings of crosses: fols. 3r, 12r. - Drawing of St. George, in pencil: fol. 1r. - Corrections written in the margins, in a fine small script: e.g., fols. 7rb, 8rb, 22vb, 27ra, 50vb, 80rb. - Erasures marked with parallel lines: e.g., fols. 3rb, 5rb, 9vb (several lines), 29va, 41vb. - Erasures without marking: fols. 13rab, 21ra, 25vb, 43va, 44rb. - Corrections over erased words or passages: fols. 5ra, 9vb, 19va, 29va, 34va, 41va,47vb, 73va, 80rb, 104ra, 105va. - Immediate corrections indicated by a line encircling the words: e.g., fols. 30vb, 86rab. - Pen trial: fol 2v. - Writing exercise: fols. 104v, 109v. - Crude doodles and letters, drawings by recent hands, in pen and pencil: e.g., fols. 77v, 78r, 89v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Recent quire marks for quires II-XII are written in the upper margin: fols. 3r, 13r, 23r, 33r, 43r, 53r, 63r, 73r, 83r, 93r, 103r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Days of the week indicating the readings in Text I-1, in pen: fols. 1v, 2rv. - Crude notes in the upper margins of Text I-3 in pen or pencil, indicating the readings for church feasts and other occasions (e.g., ዘማርያም: fol. 8r, ዘልደት: fol. 12r, ዘደብረ፡ ታቦር: fol. 26r, ዘጥምቀት: fol. 50v, ዘጻድቃን: fol. 63v). - Small piece of coloured cloth is inserted in the right upper corner of fols. 43r, 67r.
